授業目的: This course has both substantive and procedural objectives. Substantively, this course provides an overview of Japanese politics, economics, and society. Procedurally, because this is a writing intensive course, students are expected to write an analytical essay that demonstrates a clearly articulated question and thesis statement. The thesis is to be supported by logical and empirical evidence, and not merely opinion. The essay is to be well researched and written in a polished and grammatical style.
到達目標: (1) Understand contemporary history of Japanese politics, society, economy, and culture since World War II; (2) Analyze continuity, change, and challenges in various aspects of Japanese politics and society; (3) Critically evaluate the responses of the Japanese government and various actors in the Japanese politics and society to the major challenges facing Japan.
授業の概要・背景: This course offers a general introduction to the major historical, political, and social trends of contemporary Japan that affect the future of Japan, East Asia, and the world including the United States.  Unlike the courses that merely focus on economic development, political institutions, and elite politics, this course focuses on popular attitudes and culture, political participation, and the government’s response in the globalized world.
